channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Secrets of Bones
channel.desc: Ben Garrod discovers how the skeleton has adapted for vertebrates to move on land in many ways and explores the role of the spine in both cheetahs and snakes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: War Walks
channel.desc: Military historian Richard Holmes looks at some of history's major battles. This programme follows the British retreat from Mons in 1914.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Very British Romance with Lucy Worsley
channel.desc: How the Georgian age saw courtship rules being rewritten as romantic love was glamorised.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Jane Austen
channel.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the different houses in which Jane Austen lived and stayed, to discover just how much they shaped Jane's life and novels.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mansfield Park
channel.desc: Fanny Price is removed from her impoverished Portsmouth home by her Aunt Norris to live with her rich relatives at Mansfield Park.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mansfield Park
channel.desc: Fanny has grown up to be an indispensable member of the household at Mansfield Park. During Sir Thomas's absence abroad, the glam Crawfords arrive to stay in the neighbourhood.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mansfield Park
channel.desc: Fanny has sadly observed Edmund's growing fascination for Mary Crawford. To Aunt Norrie's delight, Maria has become engaged to wealthy Mr Rushworth.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Secrets of Bones
channel.desc: Ben Garrod finds out how the skeleton has allowed vertebrates to take to the air, why the pigeon is an exceptional flier and how the albatross makes huge migrations.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: War Walks
channel.desc: Military historian Richard Holmes looks at some of history's major battles. In this edition he walks through fields where the Battle of the Somme took place.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: Archaeologists find Roman objects abandoned during a British rebellion, traces of the lost Iona monastery, and a weapons hoard belonging to a wealthy Bronze Age warrior.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Operation Stonehenge
channel.desc: Documentary following a group of international archaeologists, who believe that a new state-of-the-art approach is the key to unlocking Stonehenge's secrets.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mansfield Park
channel.desc: The Mansfield theatricals collapse when Sir Thomas returns unexpectedly from Antigua. His disapproval is deep, except towards Fanny, who refused to take part.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mansfield Park
channel.desc: Henry goes to Mansfield to tell Fanny of William's promotion. To Fanny's dismay Henry confesses his love for her.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mansfield Park
channel.desc: To her distress, Fanny is attacked by Sir Thomas for rejecting Henry's marriage proposal. She is sent back to Portsmouth to reflect on her position.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Sky at Night
channel.desc: The team celebrate the 350th anniversary of the Royal Observatory, recreating history at a special dinner party, where they are joined by a glittering line-up of science communicators.

channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jo Whiley presents the pop chart programme broadcast on 9 January 1998 and featuring Lighthouse Family, Steps, Janet Jackson, Space, All Saints and Vanilla.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 16 January 1998 and featuring Robbie Williams, Clock, Lighthouse Family and All Saints.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Mike Read and Dixie Peach present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 13 June 1985. Featuring Bruce Springsteen, Madonna, Billy Ocean, Sister Sledge and Marillion.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Peter Powell and Mike Read present appearances from The Art Company, The Smiths, Scritti Politti, Ozzy Osbourne, Nick Heyward, Nik Kershaw and Frankie Goes To Hollywood.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
channel.desc: An archive celebration of Tom Jones's performances at the BBC from the start of his pop career in the mid-60s to Later. with Jools Holland in 2010 and all points in between.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tom Jones
channel.desc: Tom Jones in concert with the Treorchy Male Choir and The Blossoms. First broadcast 1971.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tom Jones at Glastonbury
channel.desc: Sir Tom Jones wows them at Worthy Farm in the teatime slot on the Pyramid Stage. Featuring Delilah, It's Not Unusual, What's New Pussycat?, Kiss, Sex Bomb and Unbelievable.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tom Jones's 1950s
channel.desc: In a personal journey through his formative years in south Wales in the 1950s, Tom Jones takes us on a trip through the decade of his childhood and adolescence.

channel.desc: With Siegfried in London, Tristan is left with the worst patients.

channel.title: Kidnapped
channel.desc: Powerful drama based on a true story. Italy, 1858. The Catholic Church removes a six-year-old Jewish boy from his family following claims that he was baptised as a baby.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Scrublands

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Charlie Drake Show
channel.desc: In a tale from 'ye olde' medieval England, 1016, error-prone jester Charlie unwittingly causes a war between Baron Stephen and the Danish invader King Cnut. From 1961.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Charlie Drake
channel.desc: Documentary profile of actor and comedian Charlie Drake. Drake had much to overcome - marital, financial and career troubles dogged him. He recalls his highs and lows. From 2001.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Brian Cox Remembers... The Lost Language of Cranes
channel.desc: Actor Brian Cox looks back on the filming of the 1991 movie The Lost Language of Cranes, about a man struggling to come to terms with his sexuality and family secrets.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Lost Language of Cranes
channel.desc: When his son confesses he is gay, Owen realises that he too can no longer live a lie. Starring Brian Cox.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Being Beethoven
channel.desc: Groomed for greatness by an often abusive father, Beethoven emerges as a great but difficult talent, an unstoppable force, until the onset of deafness tears his world apart.

channel.title: War Walks
channel.desc: A journey through six centuries of warfare. Military historian Richard Holmes reviews the strategic importance of the Battle for Arras in 1940.

channel.title: Code-Breakers
channel.desc: Documentary revealing how two men hacked into Hitler's personal super-code machine.

channel.desc: Documentary tracing the radicalisation of the Nazi policy against the Jews. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.title: Rise of the Nazis
channel.desc: The Nazis have lost in Moscow, and both dictators take charge of their armies.

channel.title: Sebasti?o Salgado
